New Records: England bowled out for 156 - the lowest all-out total ever in an ODI in Bengaluru.
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka won by eight wickets against England.
Maheesh Theekshana, Lahiru Kumara, and Angelo Mathews delivered excellent bowling performances.
Pathum Nissanka and Sadeera Samarawickrama scored outstanding half-centuries.
David Willey took two early wickets in the Powerplay.
Lahiru Kumara took 3 wickets for 35 runs.
Angelo Mathews took 2 wickets for 14 runs.
Kasun Rajitha took 2 wickets for 36 runs.
Maheesh Theekshana conceded just 21 runs from his 8.2 overs.
Sri Lanka executed two run outs.
Ben Stokes top-scored for England with 43 runs from 73 balls.
Sadeera Samarawickrama finished unbeaten on 65* from 54 balls.
Pathum Nissanka finished unbeaten on 77* from 83 balls.
Pre-Game Insights: Jos Buttler confirmed three changes for England with Liam Livingstone, Chris Woakes, and Moeen Ali returning.
Sri Lanka brought back Angelo Mathews and Lahiru Kumara.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler expressed his desire to stay on as skipper despite the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka moved up to fifth in the standings with the win.
England's defence of their World Cup crown is likely over.
Sri Lanka have now won all of their last five Men's Cricket World Cup meetings with England.
